name: Ch14ABaseConvo4
_source: speak;Lute;Fascinating specimen...|The unique striped pattern on this desert scarab suggests it's a rare variant of the Jehanna beetle.
speak;Ewan;Whoa! What are you looking at?
speak;Lute;Oh!|I didn't hear you approach, Ewan.|I'm examining this rather unique specimen of Coleoptera.
speak;Lute;Coleoptera. Beetles.|This particular desert scarab is quite rare.|I've only read about it in my studies.
speak;Ewan;That's so cool!|I love learning about desert creatures!|Can you tell me more about it?
speak;Lute;Well, since you asked...|This beetle's carapace contains microscopic ridges that reflect heat,|allowing it to survive the harshest desert conditions.
speak;Ewan;It's amazing!|How do you know so much about bugs?
speak;Lute;I know everything about most subjects.|It's simply a matter of having a superior intellect and an eidetic memory.
speak;Lute;Eidetic. It means I can recall images with precision after only seeing them briefly.|Rather useful for studying magical tomes and, of course, entomology.
speak;Ewan;That's amazing!|So this beetle... does it have any special abilities?
speak;Lute;Indeed it does.|The powder under its shell has mild magical properties.|Mages in eastern Jehanna sometimes use it to enhance fire spells.
speak;Ewan;Really?! Could I use it in my magic?|Master Saleh has been teaching me some basic spells, but I'm still learning.
speak;Lute;You're studying to become a mage?|How interesting.|What spells have you mastered so far?
speak;Ewan;Just some small wind gusts and a tiny flame.|Nothing impressive yet.
speak;Ewan;There!|See that? It's small, but it's something!
speak;Lute;Not bad for a beginner.|Your magical aura is quite developed for someone your age.
speak;Ewan;Is this... a Fire tome?|Are you giving this to me?
speak;Lute;Consider it an investment.|You learn quickly and show promising aptitude.|This is a beginner's tome, but it's well-crafted.
speak;Ewan;Thank you so much!|Wait until I show Master Saleh!|He's going to be so surprised!

speak;Lute;Just be careful not to set the sands ablaze.|Start with small targets, like rocks or small mounds.|The incantation is on page four, but don't attempt it until you've read the theory in chapter one.
speak;Ewan;I promise I'll study it thoroughly!|Maybe I could become a sage like you someday!
speak;Lute;Perhaps.|The path of a sage requires dedication and natural talent.|You seem to have both.
speak;Ewan;Would you mind if I came to ask you questions sometimes?|About magic or bugs or anything really?
speak;Lute;I suppose that would be acceptable.|It's rare to find someone genuinely interested in knowledge.
speak;Ewan;Great!|Oh, I should go now. Master Saleh will be looking for me.|Thank you for the tome, Lute!
speak;Lute;You're welcome, Ewan.|I look forward to seeing your progress.
speak;Lute;Hmm...|Interesting young mage.|Now, back to this desert beetle...
